sense.name: make useless, ruin or spoil completely
sense.examples: Most of the old part of the city was destroyed by bombs during the war. The accident seemed to have totally destroyed his confidence. The ancient manuscripts were destroyed by fire. New evidence destroyed the testimony of the prosecution's chief witness. In crowded populations, poverty destroys the possibility of cleanliness. (G.B. Shaw) Through violence and propaganda, they have destroyed hope.

sense.name: subdue or defeat completely
sense.commentary: Note: Sense of competition or encounter between 2 entities
sense.examples: The rebel forces were destroyed in battle. The home team destroyed the visitors.

sense.name: put an animal to death because of illness or danger
sense.examples: The customs agents destroyed the dog that was found to be rabid. Park officials trapped and destroyed the bear.
